info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 20 at 7:54PM CDT until April 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWESTERN AND SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWESTERN AND SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... * Affected Area...In Texas...Potter...Carson...Randall... Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Thursday: Southerly at 20 to 25 mph. * Relative Humidity...Thursday: 7 to 8 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Thursday: 4-5. * Timing...Afternoon to early evening.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
